intro: Cistanche lusitanica, commonly known as the Portuguese苁蓉, is a parasitic plant belonging to the Orobanchaceae family. It lacks chlorophyll and relies entirely on host plants for nutrients, typically growing on the roots of various shrubs and trees. The plant produces yellowish or reddish flowers and is native to regions of southern Europe and North Africa. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in arid environments. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported tonic effects.
